data.title: Margaret A. 'Peggy' Gardner
data.meta_description: Margaret A. "Peggy" Gardner, 83, of Dollar Bay, died at Portage Health on Monday, Oct. 5.
data.text:
Margaret A. "Peggy" Gardner, 83, of Dollar Bay, died at Portage Health on Monday, Oct. 5.

She was born on July 14, 1926 in Dickinson, to the late Frank and Agnes (Karsky) Sadowsky. Following graduation from Dickinson High School, she earned her associate degree in teaching from Dickinson State Teachers College.

Peggy married William Gardner on June 14, 1948 in Fargo. She was a business partner with her husband at City Drug Store in Hancock, Mich., and then at City Snyder Drug Store in Houghton, Mich. William preceded her in death in 1988.

Beside her parents and husband, she was also preceded in death by a son-in-law, Stephen Matula; two sisters, Marie and Martha; and two brothers, Frank and Wilfred.

She was a beloved wife, mother, nana and great-nana and is survived by three daughters: Deborah Gardner of Dollar Bay, Mich.; Patti Jo (Bill) Henry of Marshall, Minn.; and Colleen Matula of Gurney, Wis; three sons: William M (Anne Tews) Gardner of Lewistown, Mont.; Tim (Anne) Gardner of Menominee, Mich., and Kevin Gardner of Bigfork, Mont.; grandchildren: Matthew (Kari) Henry, Christine (Nat) Trombley, Glen, Brooke, Katelyn, Emily, Ben, Maria and Wendy Gardner; and Erin Matula; great-grandchildren: Jacob and Alex Trombley; three sisters: Sally Grasser of Northglenn, Colo.; Meg Cysewski of Rathdrum, Idaho; and Willie (Tony) Illich of Federal Way, Wash.; and nieces and nephews.

A Mass of Christian burial was celebrated at the Church of the Resurrection in Hancock, Mich., with Rev. Father Wayne Marcotte officiating. Burial was in Hancock's Lakeside Cemetery.

The O'Neill-Dennis Funeral Home in Hancock is in charge of the arrangements.

Memorials in lieu of flowers may be directed to "Turn on the Heat" campaign through Little Brothers ~ Friends of the Elderly, 527 Hancock Ave., Hancock, MI 49930 or to St. Vincent De Paul Society in Hancock.

Online condolences may be made at www.oneilldennisfh.com .

O'Neill-Dennis Funeral Home, Hancock, Mich.
